definitions.definition: the row of small bones that are connected together down the middle of the back

examples.text: A shiver went down my spine.

definitions.definition: the central feature of something or the main source of its strength

examples.text: These speeches form the spine of his election campaign.
Their protests stiffened the spines of party activists.
The legislature must grow a spine and demand these changes.

definitions.definition: any of the sharp, pointed parts like needles on some plants and animals

examples.text: Porcupines use their spines to protect themselves.
Hedgehogs are covered with sharp spines.
Once embedded in the skin, these savage spines are difficult to dislodge.

definitions.definition: the narrow part of the cover of a book that the pages are joined to

wordOrigin: late Middle English: shortening of Old French espine, or from Latin spina ‘thorn, prickle, backbone’.
